update.description:
It is not stated explicitly in the [SDFormat 1.7 frame semantics proposal](http://sdformat.org/tutorials?tut=pose_frame_semantics_proposal&cat=pose_semantics_docs&) that `world` may not be specified as a child link of a joint, though we did discuss that to some extent during the design process. I added some tests to see how the current implementation handles this case, and it complains when constructing the `FrameAttachedToGraph` that the child link named `world` cannot be found, which causes the joint vertex to be disconnected from a link vertex. This is not a problem when specifying `world` as a parent link because the joint frame is not attached to the parent link.

We should consider explicitly adding the requirement that `world` not be specified as the child link of a joint to the proposal and SDF specification.
update.title: Add tests to confirm that world is not allowed as child link of a joint

pull_request.title: Add tests to confirm that world is not allowed as child link of a joint
